comments: a(n) is the number of generalized compositions of n when there are 2^(i+1) different types of i, (i=1,2,...). [From _Milan Janjic_, Sep 24 2010]a(n) is the number of generalized compositions of n when there are 3*2^(i-1) different types of i, (i=1,2,...). [From _Milan Janjic_, Sep 24 2010]
links: Milan Janjic, Enumerative Formulas for Some Functions on Finite Sets
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 883
formula: Binomial transform of A122117 . - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 19 2006a(0)=1, a(n)=3*5^(n-1) for n>=1 . - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 19 2006
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1-2x)/(1-5x),{x,0,30}],x] (* or *) Join[{1}, NestList[5#&,3,29]]  (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 25 2011 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [ n eq 0 select 1 else 3*5^(n-1): n in [0..20] ];
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Wrong formula deleted and MAGMA program added by _Klaus Brockhaus_, Apr 04 2010
